title: cmcripto
author: cmcripto
content: We all know how volatile and unpredictable the cryptocurrency market can be. One month, a coin may be at its peak of value, and the next, it may have almost no value at all. Unfortunately, this is simply the name of the game when it comes to cryptography. But what would happen if the oldest and most valuable asset on the market, Bitcoin, dropped to zero? https://portalcripto.com.br/en/crypto-crash-2022-bitcoin-pode-valer-zero/font: https://portalcripto.com.br

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: cmcripto on August 29, 2022, 03:53:27 PMOne month, a coin may be at its peak of value, and the next, it may have almost no value at all. Most likely it was a shitcoin which was riding on hype and had no real value whatsoever.Quote from: cmcripto on August 29, 2022, 03:53:27 PMBut what would happen if the oldest and most valuable asset on the market, Bitcoin, dropped to zero? What would happen if gold or real estate dropped to zero.Bitcoin has survived long enough to not have this type of arguments around it.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: cmcripto on August 29, 2022, 03:53:27 PMBut what would happen if the oldest and most valuable asset on the market, Bitcoin, dropped to zero? Such thing would happen only if an unrecoverable and very big problem would be found in Bitcoin. Until now no such thing has happened (the big problems were early and recoverable), so we can say it has already passed the test of time and 0-value scenario is pretty much unlikely.However, was this a genuine question or just some attempt to advertise a website?

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: OP, I can understand that your concern and what has prompted this question, which is as a result of the recent dip in the price of btc, where the price dropped below the $20k mark yet again, almost unexpected and it is causing uncertainty to brew in the mind of hodlers. Btc may dip further, but the price will never get to zero, at least that is something everybody who has been with bitcoin can say in agreement. There is a possibility for other coins to get to zero, but not bitcoin IMO.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: If a 51% attack has happened then it could be one of the reason in the past. But is there any history in the early past of it that this has ever happened? The projects that had been 51% attacked still has some value but that made their projects deteriorate. Quote from: NeuroticFish on August 29, 2022, 04:53:44 PMHowever, was this a genuine question or just some attempt to advertise a website?I believe it's the latter.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: jossiel on August 29, 2022, 07:29:48 PMBut is there any history in the early past of it that this has ever happened? No, Bitcoin has not had a 51% attack, as far as I'm aware.Comparing the risk and reward ratio, attempting such an attack on Bitcoin would be very difficult to pull of. For one, it has a huge capital requirement to even attempt it, and there's no guarantee that the attacker would actually get any benefit from it.The hashrate is also growing, making it more difficult with time.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I would say that Bitcoin CAN be worth 0, but it's extremely unlikely.  I'm sure there's a price it would drop to where people would be interested in owning it as a keepsake.  Look at Namecoin...  Nobody really uses that for anything these days but it's still got a market cap in the millions.  I imagine if Bitcoin dropped to a penny, many people could afford to buy them all just for shits and giggles as they say.  It would take a pretty catastrophic event for nobody in the world to be willing to pay a penny for a BTC.  I think if that happened, the price of Bitcoin would be the least of anyone's concerns.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: I think it will take a very long time before Bitcoin become worth zero if it will be.  But in the current situation, Bitcoin is far from going worthless because its foundation is already established.  On the contrary, I think Bitcoin is more likely to continue to have an uptrend chart because of the strong effect of speculations.But, assuming Bitcoin becomes zero, I am sure, the world will move on, there may be lots of people who went bankrupt but  I am sure there are also who profited from this event.
